articles.title: Prediction Markets Are 95% Sure Nvidia Will Beat Earnings -- Here's What That Means for Investors
articles.summary: Prediction markets are pricing in a 95% chance that Nvidia will exceed Wall Street's earnings expectations when it reports quarterly results. This near-certainty suggests either the markets have spotted something analysts missed, or the real money is betting on a blowout quarter that could reshape how we price AI chipmaker earnings going forward.

articles.title: Prediction Markets Are 95% Sure Nvidia Will Beat Earnings -- Here's What That Means for Investors
articles.summary: Prediction markets are pricing Nvidia's upcoming earnings beat as nearly guaranteed, with traders betting 95% odds the chip giant will exceed Wall Street expectations. This level of certainty creates a classic trap where the real money isn't on whether Nvidia beats, but by how much, since missing those sky-high expectations could trigger a brutal selloff even with decent results.

articles.title: Which crypto company will ZachXBT expose for insider trading?
articles.summary: ZachXBT, crypto's most feared on-chain detective, has someone in his crosshairs for insider trading, and the betting markets are trying to guess which company gets exposed next. Smart money should watch for volume spikes in tokens connected to his targets, since his investigations typically crater prices within hours of publication.

articles.title: Kalshi, Polymarket Studies Show Potential Value For Fed, Wall Street
articles.summary: New research suggests prediction markets like Kalshi and Polymarket could provide valuable real-time economic data for Federal Reserve policymakers and Wall Street traders. If the Fed starts officially monitoring betting odds on interest rates and inflation, it would legitimize prediction markets as serious economic indicators and likely drive massive institutional money into the space.

articles.title: Meta (META) closes above ___ on February 23? Trading Odds & Predictions
articles.summary: Meta's stock price on February 23 is generating betting action as traders wager on whether it will close above a specific threshold. The prediction market reflects broader uncertainty about Meta's near-term performance amid ongoing AI spending concerns and Reality Labs losses that continue to weigh on investor sentiment.

articles.title: S&P 500 (SPX) Opens Up or Down on February 23? Trading Odds & Predictions (Feb. 23, 2026)
articles.summary: The S&P 500's opening direction on February 23, 2026 has generated enough betting interest to warrant dedicated trading odds and predictions. Daily market direction bets represent some of the highest-volume, shortest-duration prediction markets, making this a key bellwether for how traders are positioning ahead of whatever economic catalyst is driving the speculation.

articles.title: Home Depot Earnings Is Just a Day Away -- And Nearly 86% of Prediction Markets Expect Good News
articles.summary: Home Depot reports earnings tomorrow, and prediction markets are showing 86% confidence the home improvement giant will beat expectations. This kind of lopsided betting action often signals either a slam dunk quarter or sets up a brutal surprise that could wipe out overconfident traders.

articles.title: $10 Kalshi Code SILIVE upgraded for NBA and NCAAB this month
articles.summary: Kalshi is upgrading their $10 promotional code SILIVE to include NBA and college basketball betting markets this month. The timing suggests they're positioning to capture March Madness excitement and the NBA playoff push, giving bettors more ways to use house money on high-volume sports events.

articles.title: Prediction Markets Are Booming. Here Are The Risks.
articles.summary: Prediction markets are experiencing explosive growth, but this rapid expansion comes with significant risks that could threaten the industry's future. Smart bettors need to understand these potential pitfalls now, before they get burned by regulatory crackdowns, market manipulation, or platform failures that could wipe out their stakes.

articles.title: Is Kalshi Likely to IPO in 2026?
articles.summary: Kalshi, the CFTC-regulated prediction market that's been rapidly expanding since launching in 2021, is eyeing a potential public offering within the next two years. An IPO would signal mainstream legitimacy for prediction markets and could unlock massive capital for Kalshi to compete with offshore giants like Polymarket.

articles.title: Kalshi vs. Polymarket: Which Prediction Market is Best for the Super Bowl 60?
articles.summary: Kalshi and Polymarket are battling for dominance as the go-to prediction market for Super Bowl 60 betting, with each platform offering different advantages for wagering on the big game. The winner of this head-to-head competition will likely capture serious market share in sports prediction markets, where liquidity and user experience determine which platform becomes the default choice for major sporting events.

articles.title: NCAA requests Kalshi remove ‘March Madness’ trademark from platform
articles.summary: The NCAA is demanding that prediction market Kalshi stop using the "March Madness" trademark on its platform, likely over concerns about unauthorized use of their intellectual property. This signals the NCAA's growing discomfort with prediction markets capitalizing on college basketball's biggest event, potentially setting up legal battles that could reshape how betting platforms market tournament-related products.
